suncertify.nw

Class ServerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.nw.ServerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents a server thread which encapsulates the interaction of the server with a particular client. Once the connection between the client and the server is closed, the server thread can be reused.
    Version:
    March 20, 2013
    Author:
    Moses L. Jilugu

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerThread

        public ServerThread(ServerService service)
        Creates an instance of this class.
        Parameters:
        service - ServerService to service a live connection

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Overriden run method. Waits for connections and services services them when woken up.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setSocket

        public void setSocket(java.net.Socket socket)
        Receives a new connection and notifies the run method to service the connection.
        Parameters:
        socket - socket connection to be serviced by this thread.

      • setStreams

        public void setStreams(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois,
              java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
        Receives a new connection and notifies the run method to service the connection. This is a convinience method similar to setSocket but by using share streams, various entities on the server can service a socket without terminating a connection.
        Parameters:
        ois - objectinputstream of a given socket
        oos - ObjectOutputStream of a given socket

      • isIdle

        public boolean isIdle()
        Checks if this server thread instance is is available to service new connections. ServerThread becomes idle when the connection being serviced by the thread is terminated.
        Returns:
        true if idle and false otherwise.
